text.tspan: CO₂ emissions per capita vs. the share of people living in extreme poverty,
Average CO₂ emissions per capita are measured in tonnes per year. Extreme poverty is defined as living at a consumption (or
income) level below 1.90 "international-$" per day. International $ are adjusted for price differences between countries and price
Share of population living in extreme poverty (%)
Source: Per capita CO₂ emissions (Global Carbon Project; Gapminder; UN), World Bank – WDI
